text:
*[Bug 17713] spurious warning message from termplot*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=17713>

Thomas Soeiro (<mailto:Thomas.SOEIRO@ap-hm.fr|Thomas.SOEIRO@ap-hm.fr>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
                 CC|                            |Thomas.SOEIRO@ap-hm.fr

--- Comment #1 from Thomas Soeiro (<mailto:Thomas.SOEIRO@ap-hm.fr|Thomas.SOEIRO@ap-hm.fr>) ---
Here is another way to trigger a false positive warning:

```
fit <- lm (GNP ~ splines::ns(Year, df = 3) + Unemployed, longley)
termplot(fit, terms = 1)
# Warning in termplot(fit, terms = 1) :
#   'model' appears to involve interactions: see the help page
```

text:
*[Bug 18895] New: typos in names(precip)*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18895>

            Bug ID: 18895
           Summary: typos in names(precip)
           Product: R
           Version: R 4.5.x
          Hardware: All
                OS: All
            Status: NEW
          Severity: trivial
          Priority: P5
         Component: Misc
          Assignee: <mailto:R-core@R-project.org|R-core@R-project.org>
          Reporter: <mailto:seb.meyer@fau.de|seb.meyer@fau.de>
                CC: <mailto:lindblad@gmx.com|lindblad@gmx.com>

From Bug 18890, comment 5:

There are actually cities called "Pittsburg" in the USA: it could refer to the
one in California rather than Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. I don't have access to
McNeil (1977), the 'precip' reference, but thanks to the Internet Archive, we
can find the original source from which McNeil took the data:
<https://archive.org/details/sim_statistical-abstract-of-the-united-states_1975_section-1-34/page/192/mode/1up>.
That indeed shows "Pittsburgh" in Pennsylvania with a value of 36.22 inches.

I also noticed "Bismark", which actually refers to "Bismarck" in North Dakota
(with a value of 16.16).

It's a pity that these two typos in the names were overlooked when the
"Cincinati" name was corrected in 2016 (c71661), see `help(precip)`.
